reviews.review_msg: good guy, kindness, can get inspiration from his course.
The best Professor I have seen in my whole life, Inspirational, Caring and Kindly and friendly deliver course material.

Faisal is a very good lecturer with good student engagement in class. The level of difficulty rating is somewhat misleading because difficult concepts are taught but they are made easier with good lectures (especially if students ask questions on the concepts explored). The things learned in class feel relevant in real world applications.

Great professor. Super helpful and willing to explain concepts further in depth if asked/approached. Great understanding of material and classes are fun and engaging. Would definitely take a class with him again.
I do not recommend him. you do not learn anything in his class. easy exam just students rate him high
He is the best!
Wants students to understand the material. Aims for quality not quantity.
Best of the best professor
Great guy and wants to prepare you for real-life outside of the classroom.
He is the best!!

Excellent & passionate. Explains very well. One of the saving graces of ENG dept. Unique notes. I suggest to take notes however, even though he writes on his tablet and shares that but taking notes will help you to understand his notes better. Trip to Starbucks every class, helps with making new friends from class. Final and its grading were tough.

Amazing prof. You will also learn MATLAB the way you really should know it. The class isn't very difficult and the assignments are interesting. He is not a tough grader and helps everyone get a good grade. One of the best professors I've had.

Dr Beg was great. Take a class with him if you get the chance. He really cares about your understanding. Explanations are clear and notes are great. Encourages questions. Extends discussions beyond scope of the class material (good thing). Very accessible. No midterm but prepare for weekly assignment. Wish I could've taken more courses with him.

He's a true gentleman, he treats students like friends, would take his entire class and get them free coffee, he cares for his students. His teaching style is unique, he encourages you to engage and ask questions without being judgmental. He makes the topics interesting even though they're hard to grasp and abstract. Fair exams with fair grading.
Terrible marking, awful TA, and no curving !

Faisal is definitely a great prof, and he treat people as friends. Although the course material was challenging, he kept the students in mind and catered each topic around our needs.  I've learned  so much from his lectures, and I apply them to the rest of my work. His mentoring truly had a positive impact in my life. No doubt, take his class..:)

Faisal is the best prof I have had in ensc. Lectures are informative, assignments can be time consuming but well worth doing since the account for 30% of your grade. Overall, great class and great prof.

Great prof, he makes everything clear and easy to understand during the lecture so you need minimal effort to be put for the midterm and the final. Also, his sense of humor makes the lecture worth attending. I ended up getting an A- but half of the class would end up in the A range(very rare in ensc). We need more engineering profs like him at sfu!

Great course and Great Prof. Although the last part of the course about design controller is a bit hard, once you understand it's very interesting and useful. I worked so hard on the final, and almost doubled my midterm. It's great semester
Very helpful and kind professor. This class is incredibly fun too. You learn a ton, and 80% of the grade comes from assignments/final project.

One of the BEST prof i have in my 6 years in sfu. Very very polite, friendly and notes are clear,concise and taught in a heart. Finals questions are direct examples from the text book while you have a double side cheat sheets lol!

Excellent prof, his lectures are exceptionally clear. Went to class and did well because he made sure everyone understood the material. Very helpful after class, as well. Only downside was homework assignments were weekly and very long.

So I have to write my final exam coming Monday and going through the Lecture notes of Dr.Beg, THEY ARE SO BLOODY CLEAR AND WELL PRESENTED! Man SOOOOOO Much respect for this guy. YOU SIR, ROCK!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Best Professor in the whole applied science faculty. really wants you to learn and encourages to ask questions all the time.

You will not find a better prof, I am a struggling student and I managed to pull off an A-, going to his lectures are very helpful and he encourages questions all the times. Very polite and good sense of humor.
amazing prof! midterm with an average of 67, final with average of 77. Half of the class are in the A and A- regions.
This guy is amazing. He goes over the material slowly and clearly. His tests are extremely fair, if you fail it, it's basically your fault. Very helpful. Open office hours, always there to help.

He's incredibly clear in what he tries to explain. Has an uncanny knack of explaining tough mathematical ideas in simple terms. By the end of the course, you'll be surprised how easy he made it all look. He's also very charming and enthusiastic. He makes the classroom a jovial place to be, with his jokes and relaxed attitude. Simply, a Joy !!!

IF u REALLY KNOW PROGRAMING C++,his course is xtremely easy.Hw quite easy(juz really takes lotsa time debug!But tat depends on ur code implmntation thoo.Im not genius programer & still get A!).Project basically combo of the hw's. So make damn sure get ur hw 100% done. 8 hw's(40%),1 proj(10%),mid(25%),final(25%).Cant meet deadline?Then ask xtension!
No Comments
Very nice guy who genuinely interested in the subject and in teaching his students.  Tell jokes in class too (bonus!).
nice guy, nice teaching, nice grade. I do not need anything else.
